meanings.sent1: After getting distracted, I need to refocus on my homework.
meanings.sent2: When taking a break, it's important to refocus on the task at hand.
meanings.sent3: I tried to refocus on my book, but my cat kept interrupting me.
meanings.sent4: Just like a camera lens, sometimes we need to refocus our attention.
meanings.sent5: To succeed, we must constantly refocus our efforts on our goals.

meanings.definition: To change the focus or direction of attention.
meanings.sent1: During the meeting, the speaker had to refocus the discussion on the main topic.
meanings.sent2: When the conversation veered off track, she quickly refocused everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to refocus the audience's attention by pulling a rabbit out of his hat.
meanings.sent4: Just like a compass, sometimes we need to refocus our attention on our true north.
meanings.sent5: To be an effective leader, you must know when to refocus your team on the mission.
